A hacker left a message encrypted with RSA. Rumor says both primes are Blum integers. Can you exploit this to recover the secret? Ciphertext: 1063897884423101033617564492702691698698843689411007005381697842660664729576940460922080020493962372867104086949091088385725980402392688781614437269584644

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8832297084982002791796136292556719720923710949008949279942653881277738006010216654355477539088910471781689691610496623541449267948155697050982047362020893, e=2981560306464283337602029252081837803646790793428071890910904945943874488537661452411382235060229084552137563053683447099993371501111189176452509388937607
The lower 104 bits of p are: 77020954973550278619979618376016889947


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{7v6aztw7}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1063897884423101033617564492702691698698843689411007005381697842660664729576940460922080020493962372867104086949091088385725980402392688781614437269584644
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8832297084982002791796136292556719720923710949008949279942653881277738006010216654355477539088910471781689691610496623541449267948155697050982047362020893, e=2981560306464283337602029252081837803646790793428071890910904945943874488537661452411382235060229084552137563053683447099993371501111189176452509388937607
The lower 104 bits of p are: 77020954973550278619979618376016889947
